item.description:
Card game issued one card at a time in cigarettes made by W A & A C Churchman. Two games are described using these cards.

Frisky Families is a Happy Families game. 52 cards were issued, in 13 sets of four. Each set of four is attributed to a different animal. Frisky himself, is card no 1 and he is a rabbit. The game play is similar to other set collecting games. In his turn, a player may ask another player for a certain card. If that player has such a card, he must hand it over. The turn can now be extended by asking for another card, and so on. When you have a set of four, you may lay it in front of you. After all 13 sets have been collected, the player with the most sets, wins.

Game 2 is just called Frisky.

This is a trick-taking game. In effect, you play with 52 cards, all in one suit, and the higher card is most likely to take the trick. The cards are ranked 2 to 52. Card 1, Frisky' is the highest card though and will always win the trick in which he is played. After all the cards have been played, the player with the most cards in tricks, wins.

The original game was published in 1935. Since then, there has been at least one reproduction set.

Race Condition is a card game that allows competing players to modify a shared computer program represented by playing cards.

Game cards and counters are arranged on a table top to represent the order of and relationship between instructions, the current instruction, and the values of variables. Competing players take turns modifying the computer program until one of them achieves his or her objective of setting a variable to a particular value. Players accomplish their goals by appending instructions to the program, and by performing special actions such as inserting, deleting, or moving instructions. As the players modify the program, it advances, modifying variables and potentially moving players closer to or further from their objectives.

item.description:
The game was published in 2005 as a part of a local educational program called "Mina Ise" (I myself). The game consists of 45 different cards, where there are 22 card pairs, where each pair has a regular (local Estonian, non-foregin) letters and J letter as being a part vowel and part consonant alone, making it to be 45 cards.
Each card pair has something drawn on it, either a living thing or some item. Under the picture there are a word and under a word a sentence to use the word in. Trick is the correct "kääne" (word ending).
Scoring has multiple possibilities.

Variant 1: Naming the thing on the picture and the letter it begins with scores you the card. 10 cards wins the game.

Variant 2: Each word has parts of it different colored, while yellow part is 1 point, red part 3 points and blue part 5 points. 35 points and you win the game.

From the publisher:
Game made by a local travel agency to find about more about traveling in Europe.
Game is basic roll and move, with treasure collection and trivia. Each players goal is to travel to a location shown on the card they have. Game comes with a 104 pages rule book which contains info for each country destination.
Be the first to reach destination to win the game.

Game comes in the nice box shaped like a briefcase.

First game in a series of 4, in which each game is one season in the year.
The series in meant to be education for children.

Each game in the series is meant for 2-12 young players. The first game called "Midrimäng" is about winter and the wonder of Christmas. All games later can be combines into one large game.

Game is played very easily.
Each player is a small elf that must hide behind pine trees and deliver candies into the shoes of kids. Game has a eyes of children part (for adult player) that once each turn moves around and tries to find little elves.
Do you hide or deliver for points - you decide!

Winner is the first to deliver all candies.

Object of the game is during the questions try other players
to answer forbidden words YES or NO. If somebody answer so
others must then quickly ring the bell to move their pawn on the gameboard if they are the quickest.

The winner is who gets there first with his character in the middle of the board.

link.value: Ni Oui Ni Non: edition Premium

item.description:
From the publisher:
This is a game about finding connections between different things. Game comes with so many great cards that will blow your mind.
Each player moves around the game board (Monopoly like board), where each space is a category.
Under that category someone will draw a card and asks you something. Example: "How is connected chicken egg and A4 paper format?".
Answer correct, collect the card and keep moving. Idea is to reach the center field and be crowned as smart as Da Vinci himself.

Educational game made for schools to introduce 4 parts of the nature. Game is simple, just roll and move through the game board and collect knowledge.
On the way to the end, you must stop on card spaces and answer what it on the picture.

Also, the rule book is 76 pages and can be used as small RPG with d20 dice and a journey to the nature.
On they way you have to get out of swamps and make choices of roads and so on. Goal is still to reach the end, but this way the game is more educational than the regular way.

First one to reach the end is the winner.

Game was created as a part of a student program and was put together by over 50 student ideas.

From the publisher:
"Clean water ABC" is a educational game about saving pure water. Game board is a pipeline to different parts in a house and all players starts from a plant that pumps water.
Goal is to reduce the water consume.
Players go around the house and stop leaks, not using water while washing hands etc.
When you have certain amount of points, you can proceed to the end - waste water plant.
First one there is the winner.

Promotional game for bread. The game is about making bread.

Game is played on a Monopoly like game board, with outer track being the break making track and inner snake like track for getting points to reach next levels on your bread making track.

Game is played in turns and in the inner track. You move there according to dice rolls and do what the spaces say. Each time you reach red space, you can take next step on the bread making track and reading out loud, how the process is made.
Winner is the first player to finish the bread.

"When two wizards test their strengths against eachother in a magic duel several factors decides the outcome; the ability to learn and adapt fast to changes, flexibility in strategy and tactics when necessary, master of both attack and defense, courage to try the unknown and wits to outsmart the other combatant." 
All these things matter when playing Expell.

Expell is a deck building game set in a magical environment. Two or more players compete for survival as wizards. Make the best use of the Grimoire to optimize your deck of spells to defeat your enemies. The objective of the game is to exhaust the opponent(s) willpower with a good combination of spells and magical items.

"No strategy is good but the strategy to observe, adapt and act faster than your enemy."

The game components:

 216 Spell cards (24 different spells with 9 cards each)
 48 Power cards
 48 Darkness cards
 Willpower tokens

name.value: FISCHE FANGEN Ein frohes Petri Heil

item.description:
Objective: catch as many valuable fishes as possible before returning safely to fisherman's cottage
 - acting/moving by turn - 
roll the die, move according rolled number; ending on an 'A' marked space roll the die again 1-3 ==> bad luck; 4-6 lucky
sometime you may - if position is marked with 2 or 3 - try again.
Places are suitable for different sorts of fish - more or less valuable ==> see table 
you may also take a more risky decision: get a boat and reach very rich in fish position - but you can get lost, too;
game ends if last (surviving) player has returned to fisherman's cottage

This is two-player game that simulates the Battle of Yangxia after Wuchang Uprising during the Xinhai Revolution of 1911. Gaming period is more than 40 days from late October to December 1. Gaming map covers three towns of Wuhan (Wuchang, Hankou and Hanyang). One player commands Revolutionary Army and the other player commands Qing Forces.

Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

item.description: The game covers a operational land battle in Burma from January to May 1942. Each turn covers half a month. The map covers Burma and neighboring areas such as China India and Thailand. One player commands Imperial Japanese Army and the other player commands the Allied Forces.

What is Chemistry: An Atom Building Game?
Students compete to create the largest atom using their knowledge of chemistry in this exciting deck building game. Each player starts out with a hydrogen atom and must answer a question based on chemistry to gain quarks. The quarks are converted into one of three subatomic particles. Players can use various discoveries in chemistry (i.e. Chemistry cards) to enhance their turn to gain more quarks.

The game is designed for chemistry students and it is a fun and nontraditional way to review for tests. So, if you want to be ready for your next chemistry test, play Chemistry: An Atom Building Game.

Cup Final is a soccer board game, played on a 30x50 grid. Each player has 11 footballers on the board, which exert a zone of control which is used to intercept the ball. The ball is moved by means of dice throw which tells you how many squares the ball moves, and the direction type (e.g. diagonally). The board is also divided into 6 zones, and when the ball is moved into a new zone, an Action Card is drawn which may make you lose possession, or allow you to move the ball through ZoCs. Every five minutes the players are allowed to redistribute their footballers around the board.

Objective: be the first gaining 6 different chips 
 - moving/acting by turn -
roll the die, move & draw appropiate question card; if your answer was right ==> get a chip with correspondent colour

question categories (out of TV-series):
love & passion; emotions & jealousy; cheeky & fatal; reality & character; sadness & fate; tricks & deception;
it is not allowed collecting more than 3 chips of same colour

Objective: be the first ending on space 25 (finish line)
 - acting/moving by turn -
a 'Trivia' approach with (some) unusual challenges
1. roll the die, move your (question) meeple
2. ending on a coloured space your right neighbour draws a card 
3. Colour of the space determines sort of question, symbol if you may look out searching a partner - not your neighbour on the right - for current challenge
4. the faster (with less hints) you find the correct answer the further you (and your partner) may move your (tracking) meeple
terms you are challenged with frequently:
find/name a wanted: person, place, profession, thing, brain-twister...
techniques you may apply are puzzling, drawing, something to puzzle over, yes/no questions ....

remarks:
game was produced by Ravensburger, developed by PwC and Ravensburger

Objective: get most of all chips out of the bank
 - moving by turn - 
each player gets a square (numbered 1-6) and a correspondent round (1-6) wooden marker - surplus will be placed on the board as neutral ones;
place your marker on the board into appropiate spaces
roll the die - move your round marker as many spaces foreward by neglecting other ones; take off the very last square marker and put it ahead of the others: now check the new formed patterns: 2 of 3 with same value: gain 1 chip: 3 of 3: gain 2 chips: 3 in an increasing column: gain 4
nothing: pay penalty: 1 chip
game ends if all chips are gone

Remarks: game was produced early 1930's; target group were adults who had to buy into

This is a shooting game with a moving target.

Instructions for setting the game up:
Fit the round uprights into the wood bases, highest to the right, shortest to the left, and ensure the slots run inline down the board. Fit the printed housings or "pens" to the uprights. Target to the highest. "Home" to the shortest. The slope or ramp is made in two halves; join these together and fit into the slots in the uprights, but before securing to the highest upright, thread the Duck on the ramp. Move the Duck to its starting pen and the game is then ready for playing.

After that, if you still have energy to play;
Load the repeater gun with an agreed number of rubber bands and take aim at the target to start the duck in motion. When this has been accomplished fire the remaining bands on the gun to knock over the Duck before it reaches the "Home" pen.

Scoring is calculated according to the number of points indicated by the duck's head on the base board when it is pointing downwards,

If a player has some remaining bands on his gun after scoring, the Duck is returned to the starting pen for further play.

Summary:
Sphlag is a capture-the-flag game for two players.

This is a novel Capture-the-phlag game design for the Shibumi game family.
In this game, 2 players face each other, and try to surround their opponent's flag (or, in this case, "phlag") with their own spherical pawns.
The game uses the 4x4 Shibumi board, with a pre-defined inset of immobile pieces, creating a battleground for rounds of joy with capture-the-phlag.

Rules: 
Starting position:
The board starts with four Red spheres, two in opposite corners, and two diagonally to an imagined line between these corners in the center of the board. The two players sit opposite each other. The sphere in front of each player represents their respective flag (or, in this case, "phlag"). The spheres in the middle represent a wall. These four spheres cannot be moved.

Movement rules:
Two players, White and Black, take turns either placing a sphere of their color within their half of the game board (the half facing the player, e.g. anywhere within the triangle B7-G2-G7 for the lower player, and A6-F1-A1 for the upper player), in any level possible, or by moving their sphere up to a total of 4 spaces. No spheres can be initially placed along the diagonal line indicated by the wall (A7-G1), or the opponent’s half, although spheres can be moved into these positions.
A "space" is defined as a space on the grid (not the holes). This means that moving from one hole to the next (for example, E7-C7) involves moving 2 spaces. Player movements may involve movements up or down levels. If a sphere that supports only one other sphere is moved, the top sphere drops down into the vacated hole. If a sphere supports more than one other sphere, it is locked into place.

Other rules:
The last turn's board position cannot be repeated (ko rule). Passing is allowed. If a player cannot make a legal move, the player passes.

Aim:
Players aim to touch their opponent’s flag with as many of their own spheres as possible. There are three legal positions at which an opponent’s flag can be "touched"; E7, F6, G5 for the lower flag, and A3, B2, C1 for the upper flag.

Winning conditions:
Players win instantly upon moving at least two of their spheres into touching contact with the opponent’s flag. Otherwise, the game ends when both players pass sequentially or if both players agree to end the game. The player that has more spheres touching the opponent’s flag after ending the game wins. In case of a draw with respect to the number of spheres touching the opponent’s flag, the player with fewer spheres on the board wins. If both players have identical numbers of spheres touching their opponent’s flag, and equal numbers of spheres in the game, the game ends in a draw.

Examples of legal moves are shown in the files section.

Designed by Lars Rose, 2011.

Venezia & I Veneti: I Cicchetti (aka, "Venice and the Venetians") is a trivia game for kids to adults. It provides an entertaining journey to discover the characters, culture and sights of Venice. To advance on the board, players have to answer questions and carefully manage the travel budget. The player who reaches the end first is the winner.

Question Categories:

 Geography & Nature
 Art & Culture
 History 
 Food & Wine
 Famous People
 Venice and The Venetians Today

Game description from the publisher:

Milano: I Madunnini is a trivia game for kids to adults. It provides an entertaining journey to discover the characters, culture and sights of Milan. To advance on the board, players have to answer questions and carefully manage the travel budget. The player who reaches the end first is the winner.

Question Categories:

 Geography & Nature
 Art & Culture
 History 
 Food & Wine
 Famous People
 Milan Yesterday & Today

Vita di Gesù (aka, "The Life of Jesus") is a trivia game for kids to adults. It provides a new way to learn about Jesus in his time, the story, and the characters surrounding the path of his life. To advance on the board, players have to answer questions and carefully manage the travel budget. The player who reaches the end first is the winner.

Question Categories:

 Old Testament
 Food & Wine
 Jesus in His Time
 Geography & Nature
 The Story of Jesus
 Miracles & Parables

I Romanacci is a trivia game for kids to adults. Discover the people, culture, and curiosities of Rome, the eternal city. To advance on the board, players have to answer questions and carefully manage the travel budget. The player who reaches the end first is the winner.

Question Categories:

 Geography & Nature
 Art & Culture

 Food & Wine
 Paris Yesterday & Today
 Famous People

L'Italia & Gli Italiani (aka, "Italy and the Italians") is a trivia game for kids to adults. It provides an entertaining journey to discover the characters, culture and curiosities of Italy. To advance on the board, players have to answer questions and carefully manage the travel budget. The player who reaches the end first is the winner.

Question Categories:

I Toscanacci is a trivia game for kids to adults. It provides an entertaining journey to discover the characters, culture and sights of Tuscany. To advance on the board, players have to answer questions and carefully manage the travel budget. The player who reaches the end first is the winner.

Question Categories:

 Geography & Nature

 Famous People

Soccer Game published by Perma Toys.

The game has plastic players that are set into the game board in depressions. Those depressions attract the soccer ball. The players are spring loaded and when the soccer ball falls into their area you can attempt to pass the ball or score a goal by flicking the player pieces. There is a goalie who can block shots on goal.

50 tear-off sheets in each Paper Trails pad make this an ideal travel game. Each game combines the luck of the dice and strategy in the attempt to reach the destination before your opponent. Find the ultimate treasure in the PIRATES! edition. Each Paper Trails includes a 50-sheet Game Pad, a Pencil and Die.

Sail forth from your home point seeking buried treasure. Players roll dice to see how far they sail. An bad roll results in damage. Once each player reaches buried treasure, they must dig it up. The first player to reach their home port with all the buried treasure wins the game.

50 tear-off sheets in each Paper Trails pad make this an ideal travel game. Each game combines the luck of the dice and strategy in the attempt to reach the destination before your opponent. Be the hero of the Civil War in the HISTORIC SITES! edition. Includes a 50-sheet Game Pad, a Pencil and Die.

Both players start at their home base. Each rolls to see how far they can move. A bad roll results in damage. Receive too much damage and that player is out of the game. When a battlefield is reached, players must deliver their supplies. The fist player to deliver supplies to all the battlefields wins.

50 tear-off sheets in each Paper Trails pad make this an ideal travel game. Each game combines the luck of the dice and strategy in the attempt to reach the destination before your opponent. Be the first to hike to the Trail’s end in the HIKING! edition. Each Paper Trails includes a 50-sheet Game Pad, a Pencil and Die.

Each player starts from a starting position. Players roll dice to see how far they move. A bad roll results in damage. If a player receives too much damage is out of the game. Once players reach a checkpoint, they must roll dice each turn until their total equals/exceeds that checkpoint's number. The first player to clear all four checkpoints and reach the finish wins the game.

50 tear-off sheets in each Paper Trails pad make this an ideal travel game. Each game combines the luck of the dice and strategy in the attempt to reach the destination before your opponent. Be the hero of the Revolutionary War in the HISTORIC SITES! edition. Each Paper Trails includes a 50-sheet Game Pad, a Pencil and Die.

Each player starts from a starting position. Players roll dice to see how far they move. A bad roll results in damage. If a player receives too much damage is out of the game. Once players reach a checkpoint, they must roll dice each turn until their total equals/exceeds that checkpoint's number. The first player to clear all four checkpoints and reach the finish wins the game.

item.description:
50 tear-off sheets in each Paper Trails pad make this an ideal travel game. Each game combines the luck of the dice and strategy in the attempt to reach the destination before your opponent. Be the first to the finish line in a race across America in the ROAD TRIP! Edition. Each Paper Trails includes a 50-sheet Game Pad, a Pencil and Die.

Each player starts from a starting position. Players roll dice to see how far they move. A bad roll results in damage. If a player receives too much damage is out of the game. Once players reach a checkpoint, they must roll dice each turn until their total equals/exceeds that checkpoint's number. The first player to clear all four checkpoints and reach the finish wins the game.

CloverLeaf is a free print-to-play card game. It is a simple-to-learn yet thoughtful light strategy game for 2-4 players. Players place cards from their hands on the table in accordance with simple rules. Points are scored for covering more than one already-played card while matching the symbols on both cards.

As a two-player game, players can set up their opponents for big scores. With three or four players, the game becomes more about finding creative plays on the table.

There are four pdf files in the downloadable archive. Two are the fronts of one set of 16 cards and the rules. The other pdfs are for card backs and are optional. You will need one set of cards per player (32 cards for a two-player game.)

item.description: Party game. Players are given a story and they must look around during the party, to spot the correct words that are needed for the blanks in that story. The player who adds the most correct answers, wins.

Action game. The board is a red circle and the idea is to drop 5 white smaller circles on to the board from around a yard above, so that the red circle is completely covered. First to achieve this, wins.

"A Fast,Thrilling,Action Packed Game."

Robin the Boy Wonder has been captured by Batman's enemies. It is impossible for him to escape without assistance. Only Batman can set Robin free and to do so, he must overpower three of his villains,who are on guard in adjoining positions.

Each player has a flipper,a Batman and 4 counters. Batman is placed on the flipper and is flipped with a finger towards the board centre - Thus swooping down on the target. If he lands on one of the 8 enemy spaces, the player's coloured counter is placed there. Land in the centre and you gain an extra turn.

The player who first gets 3 counters in adjoining spaces has freed Robin and wins the game.

Contents
1 Game Surface.
4 Flipper's.
4 Playing Pieces.
24 Counter's.
Rules are printed on inner box lid.

Objective: gain as many of the 44 Micky cards as possible
 - moving/acting by turn -
each player moves according the die into a free of coice direction; ending on a marked/coloured space draw a question card;
name - according colour - a land (green); a town (red), a river/lake (blue), a mountain (brown) starting with the letter printed on card; if you are quick enough keep the card; 
ending on a 'Mickymouse' symbol draw a 'term' card to determine the colour, hereafter a question card; proceed like described above - but if you are successful you'll get a 2nd chance to win an additional card

Fur & Feathers is a fun, fact-filled, educational game about animals and how our everyday choices affect their lives. The object of the game is to be the first player to save one of each of the five animals (dog, cat, pig, cow and chicken). Players can do so by correctly answering interesting animal fact questions, visiting the Cafe’and ordering from a kid friendly menu (which offers healthy alternative items like soup & salad, pasta, etc.), visiting the Animal Shelter and adopting a pet or by the luck of the spinner at the Farm.

Fur & Feathers game features various spaces that allow players to move ahead, forward, visit one of the three animal areas and other positive experiences. It was designed with children in mind and has no negative consequences, the players always have a fun experience during game play.

There are plenty of fun ways to win the game but strategy and a little luck can help too!

The exciting knowledge quiz show on Super RTL!
You go with your friends on a breathtaking ride on the Q-boat at 10,000 feet down and recover the treasure. Along the way, you have to answer tricky questions and collect valuable points. Secure your points across on the cargo hatch.

The teams try to find a common solution for each correct answer and win oxygen, with which they dive deeper into the sea of knowledge. A wrong answer leads the team to the next secured surface place. There are a questions about professions, geography, medicine, nature or sports in this game with the help of two Jokers. After three dives each with 10 questions, the player/team who has emerged the greatest overall depth, is the winner.

"Soccer" in English
108 game cards with 500 questions and 500 answers.
The question is asked and the quickest player with correct answer gets a point. Who collect 25 points first wins the game.

Contents:

 108 playing cards, 
 notepad and pencil

Objective: be the first reaching top of the board/ranking list (= genius)
 - acting by turn -
1 each player rolls the die to determine the section (question cards) '6' = free of choice;
2 find the answer within a certain time - usually a minute
3 if you were right - 1 step up ==> direction 'genius'; wrong - 1 step down ==> direction 'mutt'
player may use certain materials (paper, pencil...), and spend chips (6 at the start) to extend required time

remark: same approach was used for 'Das IQ Spiel für Kinder'

300 questions for the whole family
The first player reads out a question and who first identifies the correct answer gets the card and places it in front of him. 
Game ends after predetermined amount of questions or if there are no questions left in game. Player with the most cards wins the game.

Roughly translated box back

"More Tanto Cuore" is a new series in the Tanto Cuore line. "Tanto Cuore" is a deck building game in which players are masters of a house, and use their small deck of "love" cards to employ cute maids, and gradually expanding their decks. "More Tanto Cuore" enhances this with a "worker placement" mechanism. Each round, players choose one each of the available high class maids to get help from. High class maids' assistance is needed to be able to help out with Food, Decorations or Cleaning errands.
Once the game ends, players account their Food, Decoration and Cleaning cards. Certain maids are also worth victory points by themselves. The player with the most Victory points has contributed best to the upcoming party, and is declared to be the Most Delightful Master.

From the game Introduction:
"A game about Bull Riding? Really? Yep.
8 Seconds from Glory is a fun little game that's made for having a good time with friends, family and everyone in between. It's a game with a little luck (drawing the "right" Bull) and a little skill (knowing when to use your Ride Dice). But it's mostly about fun!

Will you play it week in and week out? Probably not but you'll be able to pull it out occasionally and play without learning how to play all over again. It's simple. It's fun. You remember fun right? That's why you play games"

8 Seconds from Glory is a very little and easy game that uses the simple throw of 2 dices to adjudicate the many situations the bull rider will face during his brief cavalcade. The result of the dice is confronted with compiled tables that will tell players the outcome of the phases, the dice is no way a blind roll. Every rider (and even the bulls!) have their characteristic and their traits, so a sparkle of role-playing game is gladly implemented, as are rules to make your rider or bull progress during rodeo seasons.

Very fun to play!

Similar to Monopoly, this game has you buying properties and collecting rent on them. The financial scale is a bit different and one is buying franchises as opposed to houses and hotels.

All of the properties/franchises are related to Johnstown, Pennsylvania. It was published to sponsor and promote the Conemaugh Valley Hospital, Junior Auxiliary, Group 9.

Place, a Swedish geographical trivia game, tests players' visual recognition of famous places worldwide, their ability to place them on the world map, and their ability to answer questions about each place within a simple roll & move and memory game framework. If you answer questions incorrectly, you have to memorize the answers because the same question can become relevant again. The first player to travel around the world and fill up his game board wins.

item.description:
Present Drop was the winning entry in the BoardGameCamp 2010 game jam, for a game that fitted entirely on a sheet of A4. The prize was it being printed on the back of every Cadbury selection box the following year.

It's a Christmas tile-placing game for 2-4 players in which presents fall down chimneys into hearths. However, the path of falling presents does not always run smoothly and players may divert presents into their own hearths by altering the course of the chimneys.

Chimney tiles are positioned each turn by players hoping to funnel presents into their hearths or away from other players'. The chimneys may split, curve or even multiply the number of presents that fall through them. Some chimney tiles have presents on them that signal a drop. Before those tiles are placed, presents fall down each column and into the hearths. Each present is worth a point. At the end of the game there is a final present drop and the players total up their points.

Based on the Television show of the same name. There are many international versions of the show, including The Shark Tank, in the United States.

From the CBC website:

You are a Dragon. You are going to hear about some amazing ideas; some are great successes and some are embarrassing flops! With over 300 inventions from Victorian times to the present, can you sort out the brilliant from the bonkers? Are you in or out?

The goal of the Dragons' Den Board Game is simple - make as much money as you can! You start with $500,000 and three Dragon cards. In each round of the game, you and your fellow Dragons hear about six inventions. You must decide if each invention is a Goldmine, a Success or a Flop, and make an investment on the appropriate square on the board. You double your money if you're right; you lose your money if you're wrong, and you can outsmart and out-deal the other Dragons along the way.

The game includes: a table-top size full colour game board, 340 invention cards, 18 Dragon cards, 2 markers, and a big bundle of Dragon dollars.

- Family game suitable for ages 8+
- 2-6 Players

item.description:
Game description from the publisher:

Stop 'n Go is a quick action card game in which play is driven by hand-eye coordination and quick responses. Players race to be the first to get rid of their cards by matching colors and watching out for special cards: Zap, Pass, and Stop 'n Go!

In War of the Ring, one player takes control of the Free Peoples (FP), the other player controls Shadow Armies (SA). Initially, the Free People Nations are reluctant to take arms against Sauron, so they must be attacked by Sauron or persuaded by Gandalf or other Companions, before they start to fight properly: this is represented by the Political Track, which shows if a Nation is ready to fight in the War of the Ring or not.

The game can be won by a military victory, if Sauron conquers a certain number of Free People cities and strongholds or vice versa. But the true hope of the Free Peoples lies with the quest of the Ringbearer: while the armies clash across Middle Earth, the Fellowship of the Ring is trying to get secretly to Mount Doom to destroy the One Ring. Sauron is not aware of the real intention of his enemies but is looking across Middle Earth for the precious Ring, so that the Fellowship is going to face numerous dangers, represented by the rules of The Hunt for the Ring. But the Companions can spur the Free Peoples to the fight against Sauron, so the Free People player must balance the need to protect the Ringbearer from harm, against the attempt to raise a proper defense against the armies of the Shadow, so that they do not overrun Middle Earth before the Ringbearer completes his quest.

Each game turn revolves around the roll of Action Dice: each die corresponds to an action that a player can do during a turn. Depending on the face rolled on each die, different actions are possible (moving armies, characters, recruiting troops, advancing a Political Track).

Action dice can also be used to draw or play Event Cards. Event Cards are played to represent specific events from the story (or events that could possibly have happened) that cannot be portrayed through normal game-play. Each Event Card can also create an unexpected turn in the game, allowing special actions or altering the course of a battle.

item.description:
It's a fencing tournament, where they can participate 2 to 8 players simultaneously. It is a game dominated intuition, but also requires a little strategy to determine which will be the action most suitable sensing and analyzing the possibilities of the rival.

Actions on Pedana are carried out contemporary, following a timeline, with a dynamic system that determines a number of actions variable simultaneously on each shift.

---

Es un torneo de esgrima, donde pueden participar de 2 a 8 jugadores en forma simultánea.

Es un juego donde predomina la intuición, pero que requiere también un poco de estrategia para determinar cuales serán las acciones mas convenientes, intuyendo y analizando las posibilidades del rival.

Las acciones sobre la pedana se realizan en forma contemporánea, siguiendo una línea de tiempo, con un sistema dinámico que determina un número de acciones simultáneas variable en cada turno

"Korrutuskalake" is a simple math game for very little kids, to teach them multiplying in the range of 100.
In the game you have small river with a table for each number from 1 to 10, making it the multiplications of 1 to 100.
Each player on their turn roll 2 d10 dice and then have to quickly say the multiplication of the two and add their fish to the board, on the right number.

The winner is the player who manages get all their fish into the lake first.

The game about reducing the waste produced for The Environmental Board of Estonia.

Usual roll and move game where winner is the player who reaches first to finish. Player who landed space with logo must say before next rolling something about reducing or avoiding the waste.

There are 4 cards with different garbage can and 46 different packages for sorting the correct garbage cans.

Players place the cards from their hands for the garbage cans and write down their card numbers. If the deck is exhausted they check cards have they placed to correct garbage can. 
Player who has played the most cards correctly is the winner.

From the back cover:
Who's got the most extensive telecoms coverage? Who has the best quality? Whose coverage includes every village, town and city - right through to the most far flung corner of every region across the whole country?
COVERAGE! is a challenging and exciting board game where you have to develop your won telecoms network. Your playground is whole Estonia - so competition is fierce!

The telecommunications sector is developing rapidly: you have to be in it to win it, with victory going to a truly talented network operative - one who's able to plan several steps ahead, able to think big and act local, one who's not afraid of taking risks!

Elisa'a new board game COVERAGE! is a tricky, fast paced showdown between players who need to rely on both cunning and luck to win. The gauntlet has been thrown down: let the game begin!

Includes: game board, 60 game cards, 186 tokens, 15 coverage markers

Tactyx is played on a 12 x 12 board. There are 4 coloured sections on each edge of the board. Diagonal moves are not allowed. To make this important rule visible all the time, the board is painted with 12 x 12 circles which are connected with vertical and horizontal lines (and no diagonal ones).

There are 2 red and 2 black banks on two opposing sides of the board. These bands are used to determine the coordinates of each place in a section on the board.

Each player has 6 tokens. At the beginning of the game the board is empty. By throwing the 2 dice, one red, the other black, the players determine the location where their tokens enter the game (in the section corresponding their color).

The goal of the game is to move all 6 tokens from the starting section to the diagonally opposing section. The first player who reached this, is the winner.

From the back cover:
"Eesti Laulude Mäng" (The game of Estonian songs) is a board game for ages 12+, although we are sure, that even a younger players can handle the game and find answers the adults cannot. So, one might say, that the game is meant for all ages just like the differential Estonian music. The can be played alone and as a team.

In this game you need to answer six different questions. Players move around the board according to the track drawn there and answering the questions according to the space they are standing on. Important thing is to keep a fun and happy attitude and even sing along with the songs. When a player suddenly finds themselves on Rock board on a Pirate space, the player must give up one card he had already won. The reason this game has a Pirate space is because in real life a lot of music is stolen as well, so hopefully this space has a small motivational purpose as not to steal music. We are sorry! The Pirate space will not affect a player who already has 6 cards. When players finds himself on a corner, then he can choose the category. You need to collect 6 different colored cards, this is how you win the golden record. 
To win the game, you need to stand on one of the finish squares and the player to the left ask one question and this time you need to sing the answer. Get it right, and win the game.

From the back cover:
Board game "Teadlik Tarbija" (Smart Consumer) got started in the Consumer Protection Department competition for school children named "We can do it". The game was designed by a Tartu Hiie school children and they presented it in 2005 for the named competition. All the art were made by a local school girl Cathlyn Olev (from Viimsi High 7th grade).

In the Tartu Hiie school all children there wither have a hearing or seeing disability. They say about the game they made like this:

"It was really hard to find the idea for the game at first. We looked at many different types of games and finally we thought to make something like Monopoly, but simpler. We thought, that a usual dice game with questions would be simple enough for us to do. We thought up the questions and made the cards. So that we wouldn't have to know all the answers, we made few cards with answers already on them, so we could move forward and backwards as well. The goal of the game is to learn about consuming and how to do it with reason!"

Game is played with dice rolls and answering questions. First person to reach the end, will win the game.

Self-published, hand crafted, and now available from: Solway Games: sargent254@btinternet.com

Following in the sandy footprints of Isla Tetra comes its card-driven 2-player cousin, Isla Tetra 2.

It’s been three days since that terrible event: The violent turbulence; the acrid smell of smoke; the sudden descent and then the panicked screams of other passengers. You’re in shock, hungry and disoriented. The shore is littered with debris from the crash, but what to do first? Food? Fire? Explore the island? Help!

Expert survivors will accrue more points during their time on Isla Tetra through cunning inventory expansion, clever health management, and successful completion of a set number of survival tasks. The game is played solo, or as a survival competition against the clock between 2 players - yes, it didn’t take long for an argument to break out over scarce supplies and resources, and now it’s a race to simply stay alive.

You might think you can get by, simply walking the sun-kissed sands hunting for red snapper, allowing the hypnotic effect of the crashing waves to ease your injuries, but as you soak up the sun events back home are taking a turn for the worse: As the months tick by, the search for your downed plane is eventually called off, your job is readvertised, and your car has been sold to keep up with the bills. After two years of waiting, your family holds a memorial service and your partner is now returning to a social life as a single person.

Players must strike a balance between plundering the island’s resources for points while ensuring they’re not last off the island to face the worst news once home (and the most penalty points). Each day you’ll beachcomb the golden sands to see what has been gifted to you from the azure, salty brine. Use this flotsam and jetsam, such as rusty cans and broken umbrellas, represented by chunky, 3D DriftCube shapes, to build a shelter, craft essential tools and a fishing spear; then explore deep into the island's heart. Link the same DriftCubes together on your playmat to ‘build’ action grids, such as exploring, fishing, and foraging for food. In these instances DriftCube shapes represent time as opposed to raw materials.

It’s a race for survival. It’s a race to get home...

"It's Ubongo meets Lost" - review comment

On a hexagonal gameboard, two or three players must move their pawns and drive out competitors. Each piece has the potential to force and displacement different in each of its six sides, respectively 1, 6, 3, 5, 2 and 4. At each turn, you can either move or rotate a sixth one of his pawns to move into position to attack later. Étoiles filantes (Shooting Star) is also very interesting for three players. Players must then negotiate alliances point while being cautious of reversals that are sure to occur as soon as your partner suddenly finds you too threatening.

Object of the game is to remove opponent's pawns from the board.

The game has won the 1988 Golden Pawn Award in strategy games category.

name.value: The Big Bang Theory: Fact or Fiction Game
The Big Bang Theory Trivia Game Fan Edition

item.description:

Included are: Fact Cards, Fiction cards, Character Cards, Game board, 8 Playing Pieces, Die, Pad of Paper, and Comprehensive instruction manual.

item.description:
Objective: collect as many bonus points as possible, but don't miss to be back home on time
- tactical (geographical) quiz - so called on back of box
3 phases - moving by turn - each player starts on his marked/coloured area
I move around collecting cards/images
II answer questions regarding images/cards you hold - if you fail discard card
III get back home (can be difficult) - don't miss the plane/boat
content:
1 board, 60 cards/images, 6 ports/cards, 20 red chips, 4 vehicles with stand-ups, 8 'double-sided' stones to point out directions, 2 rain slides, 1 die, 1 rule
3 similar editions existing for Germany, Italy & US

SPIN. A solitaire game for the Shibumi set

Starting the game
The player starts with a given hand of marbles of diferent colours. The other balls remain in the bag and are used as a resource pool.

The turn
1. The player places one ball from his hand on the board.
2. If the marble touches another ball of a different colour, both balls are replaced with two balls (taken from the pool) of the other third colour. 
 
Game end
The player wins if every ball from his hand is on the board and all of them are of the same colour.

Objective: collect as many bonus points as possible, but don't miss to be back home on time
- tactical (geographical) quiz - so called on back of box
3 phases - moving by turn - each player starts on his marked/coloured area
I move around collecting cards/images
II answer questions regarding images/cards you hold - if you fail discard card
III get back home (can be difficult); don't arrive being the very last one; whatever you'd collected it doesn't count
content:
1 board, 60 cards/images, 6 ports/cards, 20 red chips, 4 vehicles with stand-ups, 8 'double-sided' stones to point out directions, 2 rain slides, 1 die, 1 rule
3 similar editions existing for France, Italy & US

Word Wave is the fast-paced game of word making and taking. This game challenges you to find words fast. Create words and shout them out as wave after wave of letter tiles launch from the device. Steal words from other players by adding letters to make new words. The player with the most points when the last letters launch, wins!

A switch on the side of the Word Wave machine lets you choose how often new letter tiles shoot out of the device. Each round lasts ten minutes or less.

Yahtzee variant with five colour dice instead of number dice. Unlike most such variants for children (for instance Yahtzee Jr. which in Swedish has the same name as this game), in this one you do not keep a record of categories chosen in previous rounds. Instead each round involves rolling and aiming afresh for one of five categories: two pairs (2p), three of a kind (3p), full house (5p), four of a kind (7p) or five of a kind (10p). After ten rounds, points are added up to determine the winner.

item.description:
From the game box:
The princesses set out for a walk in the garden. What beautiful weather today and the flowers smell wonderful! Each princess wants to create the most beautiful bouquet - help a princess and find hidden in the garden wonderful and colorful flowers! The one who first arranges a fragrant, colorful bouquet - wins!

To win the game you need to collect 6 (2 players), 4 (3 players) or 3 (4 players) tokens with flowers on them.
Players move around the game board and trying to collect flower tokens, but not all tokens are good.
Broken branch - move 3 steps to which ever direction
Crown - miss a turn
Rubin heart - miss two turns
Shoe - stay until roll a 3
Roses - move 4 steps in free direction

From the game box:
Snow White made a little party for her friends. She is still waiting for the seven dwarves, who are on their why home from the mines. Help the all get home as fast as you can. Road is long and Snow White is waiting them badly.
Snow White's Party - fun game on 3D game board.

Each player plays one dwarf and game is simple roll and move game. On the way to the house, there are many paths and on each path there are many spaces for a dwarf to land on.
Butterfly stone - roll more than 4, you get +3 moves, you roll less then 4, you miss 2 turn, you roll 1, you go back to the beginning.
White cloud - change places with who ever on the board.
Rabbit - +2 moves
Mushroom - -2 moves
Squirrel - miss a turn
Little bird - miss a turn
Evil witch - miss 2 turn
Sleepy - whoever reaches him first, must carry him with himself. Trick is that with Sleepy, you only move when you roll odd number (1,3,5), so be wise.

First player to reach Snow White, is the winner.

item.description:
Earth was attacked before by aliens but never this big. Citizen of earth now depends on your team, the one and only Earth Defense Force (EDF), the one who saves earth an hour ago from zombie attack to once again defend earth from danger. Emergency Earth is a solo game in which you took in charge to defend earth from danger

In the game player controls a group of army trying to blast the alien and defend earth from the invasion of aliens. The alien will emerge one by one from their mother ship. The map of the game is a strip of 5 column where the mother ship is on far right while the army is on the far left. Player is given a die at first to either use it to blast the alien or tries to get funding (money $). Money is used to get more dice hence more actions and other abilities like reroll and so on.

Visit us and play more games at http://experimentalplayground.blogspot.com/
